title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 61.2 - Records required of a retail licensee not a distributor
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 61.2 - Records required of a retail licensee not a distributor

State Regulations

Tax Law, §§ 426, 445; Administrative Code of the City of

New York, §§ 11-2057, 11-2058
(a) Every person who is not a distributor, for the purpose of the State of New York
excise taxes, and who has a retail license for on- or off-premises consumption
issued by the State Liquor Authority shall keep records showing separately each
purchase of beers, wines or liquors, the name and address of the person from
whom purchased and the quantity and date of purchase. (b) Each such person shall keep the copy of
the invoice as required pursuant to the provisions of section
65.1
of this Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§
61.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
